column1: US President Donald Trump has hosted two Hanukkah events at the White House
column2: defying Covid advice again.Wednesday's gatherings occurred on the day 3
column4: according to a tally by the Covid Tracking Project - a new daily record in the country. Video on social media shows Mr Trump at one of the parties with the sound of one person coughing in the background.The president has consistently ignored official advice
column5: despite contracting Covid-19 himself.According to the Times of Israel
column6: more than 100 people attended each of the events
column7: which were held to mark the Jewish holiday.Among those in attendance was White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows
column8: who tested positive for coronavirus last month. Images on social media show him at one event without a face covering
column9: shaking hands with other maskless guests.Mr Trump's Hanukkah parties were among the 25 indoor events planned at the White House over the holiday season. He has previously defended the events
column10: saying many guests have worn masks "and I think that's a good thing".In October
column11: Mr Trump made a theatrical return to the White House after spending three days in hospital with coronavirus - removing his mask in front of reporters despite still being contagious.Several senior aides and Republican officials also fell ill with coronavirus after the president hosted an event in the White House to announce his nomination of conservative judge Amy Coney Barrett for the Supreme Court.
